resources.string: What do you know about Belgium ?
Question 1: Which flag is the flag of Belgium?
Question 3: What is the name of this statue?
Question 4: Which languages do we speak in Belgium?
Question 5: What famous junk food do we eat in Belgium?
Question 6: How many Trappist beers are there in Belgium?
Question 7: Among the following, who did not reign over Belgium?
Question 8: When did the kingdom of Belgium obtain its independency?
Question 9: Belgium is split into the Walloons and the Flemish. How are they geographically distributed?
The Walloons in the North, the Flemish in the South
The Walloons in the South, the Flemish in the North
The Walloons in the West, the Flemish in the East
The Walloons in the East, the Flemish in the West
Question 10: Which famous actress was born in Ixelles, Brussels?

The national flag of Belgium is a tricolour of three bands of black, yellow, and red. The colours were taken from the coat of arms of the Duchy of Brabant, and the vertical design may be based on the flag of France.

The Atomium is a building in Brussels originally constructed for Expo 58, the 1958 Brussels World\'s Fair. Designed by the engineer André Waterkeyn and architects André and Jean Polak, it stands 102 m (335 ft) tall. Its nine 18 m (60 ft) diameter stainless steel clad spheres are connected so that the whole forms the shape of a unit cell of an iron crystal magnified 165 billion times. It is now a museum.
Manneken Pis (meaning \'Little man Pee\' in Dutch) is a landmark small bronze sculpture (61 cm) in Brussels, depicting a naked little boy urinating into a fountain\'s basin.
Belgium has three official languages: Dutch, French and German.
Contrary to their name, French Fries are claimed to have originated in Belgium, although their exact place of origin is uncertain.
There are six Trappist beers brewed in Belgium: Achel, Chimay, Orval, Rochefort, Westvleteren, and Westmalle.
The right answer was Elisabeth. Althougt Elisabeth, daughter of King Philippe, is to be the next (and first female) sovereign of Belgians.

It was in 1830 after the Belgian revolution. It was the conflict which led to the secession of the southern provinces (mainly the former Southern Netherlands) from the United Kingdom of the Netherlands and established an independent Kingdom of Belgium.

In fact, the territory of Belgium is divided into three Regions, two of which, the Flemish Region (North) and Walloon Region (South), are in turn subdivided into provinces. The third Region, the Brussels Capital Region, is neither a province nor a part of a province.
Audrey Hepburn was born on 4 May 1929 at number 48 Rue Keyenveld in Ixelles, a municipality in Brussels, Belgium.
